div.p: Greetings and Peace. The reason I write so rarely to your piety is the lack of news worthy of you, and I do not wish to trouble you with trifles. However, the few things we have from Italy, I have explained to Master Fabricius, so that he may communicate the same to your piety, and I have asked him to add my greetings, which I also add here along with the perpetual offering of my services to your piety. Given at Chur, Rhaetia, on the 22nd of November, 1558.
Your piety's most obedient friend, J. Ja. Decambray.
To the most distinguished man, excellent in piety and learning, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, minister of the Church of Zürich, his esteemed lord and friend. In Zürich.
